title: Basketball legends honor Drazen Petrovic in Legacy Game, Hezonja shows off / News - Basketnews.com
text: Basketball legends and fans gathered in Zagreb to honor the late Drazen Petrovic, with Team Drazen securing a 110-107 victory over the Croatian national team in a special exhibition game. Basketball stars paid tribute to the legendary Drazen Petrovic in a special Legacy Game held in Zagreb, Croatia, marking what would have been his 60th birthday. More than 15,000 fans gathered to honor Petrovic's memory. The exhibition game featured a matchup between the Croatian national team and 'Team Drazen,' coached by Zeljko Obradovic and Neven Spahija. In a thrilling finish, 'Team Drazen' secured a narrow 110-107 victory, with Dzanan Musa delivering a decisive dunk in the final 20 seconds. Mario Hezonja attempted to tie the game with a three-pointer, but his long-range shot missed the mark. [Mario Hezonja](/players/9225-mario-hezonja.html) |Team:|| | Real Madrid forward finished the match with 36 points, also winning the three-point contest during halftime. Players for 'Team Drazen' included EuroLeague stars like Walter Tavares, Shane Larkin, Dzanan Musa, Mathias Lessort, Vanja Marinkovic, Dyshawn Pierre, Tornike Shengelia, Andreas Obst, and NBA big Boban Marjanovic. The Croatian team featured talents like Mario Hezonja and Roko Prkacin. Luka Doncic and Goran Dragic were in attendance, having also taken part in another tribute game in Ljubljana, 'I Feel Slovenia Night of the Dragon,' in August. Croatian stars Bojan Bogdanovic, Dario Saric, and Ivica Zubac were also present to honor Petrovic. The event attracted basketball legends such as Nikos Galis, Panagiotis Giannakis, Dejan Bodiroga, Toni Kukoc, Terry Porter, Kenny Anderson, Zarko Paspalj, Vlade Divac, Zoran Radovic, Predrag Danilovic, Ergin Ataman, Svetislav Pesic, Roko Leni Ukic, and Jorge Garbajosa. Petrovic's legacy spans a remarkable career in both European and NBA basketball. He won two EuroLeague championships with Cibona in 1985 and 1986, and a successful four-season stint in the NBA with the [New Jersey Nets](https://basketnews.com/teams/411-brooklyn-nets.html) and [Portland Trail Blazers](https://basketnews.com/teams/467-portland-trail-blazers.html). Tragically, Petrovic passed away in a car accident on June 7, 1993.
